Posts.Content: Hi its really strange but ever since I had my op 7 weeks ago my left elbow has been hurting like hell. I haven't mentioned it to anyone medical as I thought it was just 'one of them things'. I'm awaiting rads appointment  within the week but am curious as to why I have this pain. It even hurts when I touch it and feels like I've over exercised it or something. x
Posts.Title: Random aches and pains

Posts.Content: Hi I'm faced with the same dilemma. Coming up a year on anastrazole and was told the side effects would reduce. Omg my body feels like its been steam rollered and the opposite side to treatment is so painful to move I'd rather not  When I've spoken to oncology they always come back with the 'well its up to you' however 'anastrazole is the best treatment for you -here's some more painkillers'.  My children are saying the same as yours I guess and have even said I'm selfish for thinking of stopping. I want the me back that was there before all this started and this 'finding the new normal' isn't working. Sending you big gentle hugs xx
Posts.Title: Stopping Anastrazole early - advice please

Posts.Content: Hi I can't comment on this but am really interested in any feedback as I'm waiting for my results before we move forward with treatment. 5 weeks post op and nothing has been decided for me yet. I just seem to be surrounded by trials and statistics. :(  Hugsx
Posts.Title: Oncotype results and should I have chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi, I had a sizeable seroma too but it was left to re absorb. I'm 10 weeks post op and it had reduced but I|'m left with a small hard lump. They had to wait for the size to decrease before rads planning but they are happy for me now to start. Big hugs xx
Posts.Title: Lump under arm after op

Posts.Content: Thank you its just been such a shock as it is to everyone and I was told it would be rads and tamoxifen post op. Chemo is the thing I dread the most. I'm really trying to hold it together but today in particular I could bury my head in the sand. Feel like I'm walking in mud but thank you for being there x
Posts.Title: how long after surgery could treatment begin

Posts.Content: Hi its such a whirlwind isn't it. I had WLE and tested positive in one node but no suggestion of further clearance as of yet.I guess the oncologist could have a different view to what the surgeon suggested.
Posts.Title: how long after surgery could treatment begin

Posts.Content: Awh these pics made me smile and your support is so welcome xx
Posts.Title: how long after surgery could treatment begin

Posts.Content: Thanks so much. Its just everywhere I look at the moment and the feelings of loneliness are awful. Thank goodness - in a literal term - the support is here. XX
Posts.Title: how long after surgery could treatment begin

Posts.Content: Hi Carolyn the lump they removed was minuscule they said and I had 1 node positive. It was hormone linked so tamoxifen will be given. Everything seemed to be going as well as and I know things are always at the back of your mind but nobody had mentioned chemo until two days ago. I am lucky because I almost didn't go for the mammogram. The trauma of the vacuum biopsy is still with me as the anaesthetic didn't take - that's another story. And at first I was like ok lets 'kick this' - the last week I've been more like I want to hide. I'm so pleased you're now recovering and wish you a really good Christmas. Thank you for replying xx
Posts.Title: how long after surgery could treatment begin

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm just wondering how long people waited for their treatment to begin. I'm almost 4 weeks post op and thought my treatment plan was all sorted. How wrong was I as I've just found out. I'm waiting to see the oncologist but have just been told they are waiting for the results on oncotype. No one had ever mentioned this test to me but I know what it is now and am so worried. My head is all over and I'm convincing myself that the length of time waiting means the cancer will be growing again.
Posts.Title: how long after surgery could treatment begin

Posts.Content: Hi honey hope all goes well for you tomorrow x  I have my appointment on Thursday. Fingers crossed for everyone x
Posts.Title: how long after surgery could treatment begin

Posts.Content: Hi I'm a week into taking these pills would I be experiencing side effects already as my legs and shoulders feel like lead weight. I cried this morning as it took me ages to get going and felt like I was walking in cement boots grrr.  Is this short lived or is there more to come?
Posts.Title: anastrozole- help with lead joints

Posts.Content: Totally agree. Been a stress bucket all my life and still can't seem to get rid of it. Cancer just gave me something else to add to the list and its so hard to get out of the negative thought train :(
Posts.Title: NPI Scale

Posts.Content: Bless you it does make sense.I guess they will discuss this at planning?I think its just 15 blasts and I presume its to both areas. Every time I go to clinic its a different story. I cant start rads for a few weeks because I still have a swelling under my arm. The scary thing is the lymph node biopsy was almost as big as the tumour they removed from my breast so because of that they are asking me to decide whether I leave alone and just treat the breast or have both done. How awful is this disease that it leaves you feeling so indecisive about everything. Love and hugs
Posts.Title: double rads?

Posts.Content: Hi thanks for replying.I must sound really stupid sorry. I had a tumour removed from my breast and the sentinel node tested positive ( 2 others were clear). Oncologist has mentioned that I need to think whether I want radiotherapy to the lymph nodes as well as when I get it to the breast. Really stressing about everything at the moment and its all decisions again. x The side effects of lymph node radiation  seem worse than just to the breast where the tumour was.
Posts.Title: double rads?

Posts.Content: Hi thanks for replying. Did you also have rads to the breast? Thats the bit I'm confused with. Is it all done as one procedure which means more of the breast being exposed to rads?Sorry I'm just worrying about everything now. Grrr its such a minefield. Just starting on HT this morning - sat looking at the packet :( x
Posts.Title: double rads?

Posts.Content: sorry for posting twice x
Posts.Title: double rads?

Posts.Content: Thank you x She never mentioned how many treatments I am down to have and I never thought to ask I just presumed it was three weeks as previously discussed. I cant go to planning yet as this seroma is still big and need to get hold of my breast nurse. All this stress can't be helping surely? x Big hugs back x
Posts.Title: double rads?

Posts.Content: Hi head all over again and decision time. Rads to be scheduled f'or breast in a few weeks but have been asked to decide whether to have rads to axillary area too as lymph node tested positive. Don't know where to go with this. On a plus note? hormone therapy starts tomorrow. Didn't ask too many questions at the time so any advice would be great. Love and light x
Posts.Title: double rads?

Posts.Content: Hi sorry yes they removed the node as well as the tumour. My oncotype result came back to say I didn't need chemo but then I'm left with a 2 week decision whether to have the node area plus the breast given radiotherapy. I should have asked for more info but you just forget at the time. I'm so confused and that's before I start on the anastrozole tomorrow. You see a little light (no chemo) and then it disappears. Thank God for this forum.
Posts.Title: double rads?

Posts.Content: Bless you it does make sense.I guess they will discuss this at planning?I think its just 15 blasts and I presume its to both areas. Every time I go to clinic its a different story. I cant start rads for a few weeks because I still have a swelling under my arm. The scary thing is the lymph node biopsy was almost as big as the tumour they removed from my breast so because of that they are asking me to decide whether I leave alone and just treat the breast or have both done. How awful is this disease that it leaves you feeling so indecisive about everything. Love and hugs
Posts.Title: double rads?

Posts.Content: Hi just into my rads treatment and mentioned that my skin felt sensitive last night. I was asked whether I was using the aqueous cream to wash with and whether I also used it on the breast. I said I was and that also I used Holland and Barrett Aloe Vera 99 which certainly eased the area. The radiographer was adamant that I only wash with the aqueous and if the skin feels sore to put cold flannel. Whilst respecting her advice I am scared to use anything so would you be able to tell me what I should be doing especially as Christmas is coming up, I have a break, and really don't want to have breaks in my skin. Thank you
Posts.Title: creams to use

Posts.Content: Thank you x. Using aqueous to wash with ( rubbish) and then nothing. Dr wont prescribe R1 or 2 so am tempted to get some off the internet however I've got Aveeno and wondered if just a little bit would do any harm hours before I go for treatment. Still like the Aloe Vera though cos it really cools everything down otherwise I'm off to Morrys for a cabbage  bless you that made me laugh x Take care xx
Posts.Title: creams to use

Posts.Content: Thank you xx Good luck with your treatment too. I have to stay with the aqueous cream for now  xx Cant wait for it to be over - 6th one tomorrow Hugs x
Posts.Title: creams to use
